page.title: 28N. Sevenoaks, Seal & Kemsing
page.content:
This is a residential area on the north edge of Sevenoaks merging into farmland and woodland.

The 19th.C. Bat and Ball station is so called because the former industry, manufacturing cricket bats and balls attracted commuters to the area.

Seal is an old picturesque village on the old Saxon road (now A25) from Winchester to Maidstone.

Kemsing is a typical Downland Pilgrim's Way village with a church and a Well of interest. There is no longer a Youth Hostel as it has been converted to houses.

There are many former gravel pits now filled with water and used in a variety of ways - Nature Reserve, Water sports and park.

There is a small modern industrial estate, supporting light industry on the site of the old brick works at the Chaucer Estate.

Contribution by: Kemsing Heritage Centre Association
